website_summaries.verdict: A slightly more affordable variety because moose antlers are more yielding, making them a fine choice for moderate chewers.
pros: Uses top-quality moose antlers that won’t splinter or crack
Available in large, XL, or jumbo

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving Picture and Product Description - Don't spend the money!
customer_reviews.text: Prairie Dog Pet Products needs to clean up their advertising act. I've purchased moose antlers (and deer, and elk) from other companies, but Amazon is so wonderfully convenient, I threw a couple on a recent order. Don't do it! They were tiny pieces, not close to the minimum measurements listed, nor anything like the picture. For this price, this is not the product they advertise. The picture I added shows an old (and already chewed!) piece at the top from another company - the bottom two are the "extra-large" pieces I just received. This company is not representing the overall quality of Amazon's other services and products at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly D.

customer_reviews.title: Way to get boned.
customer_reviews.text: Buy elk/moose/deer antlers all the time and tried this brand for the first time. I bought the non-split moose XL for my heavy chewer (45lb Australian Cattle Dog who can destroy a Kong toy like it's made of tissue paper) and another company's medium for my 6-month-old puppy. As usual, they immediately switched bones and within 4 days, the puppy had this XL Moose antler down to a nub so smaller (and splintered everywhere). The ACD and pup share the other, cheap antler now and it's going strong like it's brand new. As many have stated - these size descriptions are as inflated. I feel certain we'll find out that Trump's staff is ultimately behind the marketing on these.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie or Holly

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two at once. One was good length, decent diameter, clearly from a larger antler cut lengthwise a few times. Second one was half as long, half as thick, and the shape of a slice of spam. No indication it came from an antler. My two dogs took turns on them. They loved them both. After a total of 5 hours of chewing over a few days, the small one is now a 1/4 the size it started, and now a choking hazard. The larger one is holding up about as I'd expect. At over ten bucks apiece, the large one is a good purchase. The small one a waste. Sigh...
customer_reviews.author: Dabbler

customer_reviews.title: He loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Fox Red lab pup. He is teething and really loves his antlers. He loved the moose antler, but from the human perspective, it left a mess and didn't last long enough. Pros: The dog didn't stop chewing it until it was gone, he loved it. It is softer than deer and elk and may be a little safer as it does not splinter. Cons: Since its softer and doesn't splinter it left little crumb like bits all over the rug. Moose antlers are a little more pricey so I would've been happier if it lasted longer than a day or 2 of solid chewing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... antler because the description says that moose antlers are best for powerful chewers
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this moose antler because the description says that moose antlers are best for powerful chewers. I have gotten numerous deer and elk antlers in the past that have lasted for weeks or months. I gave this to my 60lb shepherd/pit mix about an hour ago and she really loves it but there is only about a 1/3 of the antler left. Not only is it disappearing quickly, but the smell is awful. Since she likes to chew my son's socks after football practice it doesn't surprise me but the smell really is horrible. I will not be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: robyn

customer_reviews.title: Runs extremely small
customer_reviews.text: The "X-large" antler delivered to me was minuscule - too small to be safe for my dog to chew. I was hoping to replace an almost-finished antler by another brand that was about 6 times the size of the Prairie Dog brand antler delivered. Unfortunately, no return/refund was allowed by Amazon, for reasons I don't understand. A waste.
customer_reviews.author: B. Day

customer_reviews.title: My German Shepherds love them!
customer_reviews.text: These may not take my German Shepherds “months” to wear down, as I was once told at a pet supply store (that moose antler was down to a nub by the end of the day), but they certainly keep them busy longer than many other “long lasting” chews.
customer_reviews.author: H. Carrion

customer_reviews.title: I guess 2 outta 3 isn’t too bad.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of the XL moose antlers. Two of them were perfect and exactly how they had been described. The third one looked more like a deer antler and none of my dogs wanted anything to do with it. I was going to order more for xmas but I don’t think I will now. I don’t know how to return just one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very false advertising under 15 minutes to crumble😡
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my 2 dogs. A lab and a 42# kelpie mix. These are not pit bulls with extra strong bites! I have given them deer antlers that they work on for weeks and expected at least more than 15 minutes. Very dry and kind of spongy in the center. I will complain and ask for a refund but don't believe that this is the way to go for a long lasting chew option. Nothing suggested they would fracture and crumble. Serious waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Upstate NY

customer_reviews.title: These Moose Antler Chews Splintered Too Easily!!
customer_reviews.text: These Moose Antler Treats were not good quality. They splintered too easily and I had to take them away from my dog and trash them. The pieces that came off were sometimes a half inch to an inch long and incredibly sharp. If my dog would have swallowed them there could have been major medical issues. I would not buy these Prairie Dog Pet Products Moose Antler Treats again.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Fields

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: The picture for the moose antler vs what I got are like two completely different items! They look nothing alike! I'm hoping my spoiled little pit will still be interested in it. Now the only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because mine seems to be a bit longer then others (It's about the length of my hand if not a little shorter. My hands about 7inches long from palm to the longest finger)
customer_reviews.author: Tarin Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Faux Antlers
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with these moose antlers. My dogs chewed them up in a few days! I have bought antlers before and they have lasted for months. they are far too expensive to get chewed up that fast. I will not buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: MarloSD

customer_reviews.title: Splintered immediately, dangerous product!
customer_reviews.text: Very upset with this antler. It splintered within a minute of my dog chewing on it. This is a very dangerous product as if she swallowed the splintered off pieces (which she was starting to do) she could have cut her insides open! This hasn't happened with other antlers before. Disappointing, what a waist, just threw $13 in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Kayli S.

customer_reviews.title: Not giant, not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Not giant, and while the picture is accurate (in that it's a flat cut) that meant that my pup chewed through it in record time. She has another moose antler that round that she's been chewing on for over a month - but this one she went through in a couple of chewing sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Just-a-Mom

customer_reviews.title: Hardly an XL slice
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a few moose antlers both from amazon and another antler company. These being sold as XL are smaller than the competitor but they are also a little cheaper, so i have been ok with it. Today the one i received is thinner than the cardboard box it was derived in. Hardly an XL piece. Very disappointed in the sizing compared to past orders.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole S

customer_reviews.title: Not extra large maybe small would be a better description
customer_reviews.text: Description of XL was not accurate. Very small for the size and our dog ha it down to an extra small within day. Had a lot of small pieces from the antler also. Had to buy another antler at a local pet shop with a similar price but this one s about 14 inches long and 1.5 inches in diameter. The dog has been chewing on it for a week now and still only shows minor wear. Much better product.
customer_reviews.author: flanker

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Expected it to last much longer for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Expected it to last much longer for the price. My dog devoured half of it in one sitting! I’ll stick to unsplit elk antlers from now on. The photo showed an unsplit antler, so that’s what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Murphey

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last an hour
customer_reviews.text: Didn't hold up well for my chewer. I read moose antlers are best for aggressive chewers, well my American bulldog pretty much "ate" half of it within the first hour of having it. I had to throw it out same day I got it in the mail since it was disappearing in my dogs belly. He hasn't had an upset stomach I just don't think he should be eating a toy that's supposed to hold up to chewing. I've given him real antler found by a hunting friend and he's had that for months I wish I could get more!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not X-large
customer_reviews.text: While the price and description implied X-large, I ordered three, but only one was close to X-large. See picture to illustrate my point. The small ones are clearly not worth the price, better to buy from local store.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Small, didn’t last long. Rip off.
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than expected, smaller than the size chart claimed. Didn’t last long and was not what was pictured. Was quickly Broken into pieces small enough to easily choke my dog. I wouldn’t order one again, and I wouldn’t recommend you do either.
customer_reviews.author: Gray Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Not xl and not worth 15 dollars
customer_reviews.text: The antlers that were sent to me did not look like the picture. They were only 5 inches long and an inch wide at most. The only good thing is that the antlers are durable but I will not be buying from this person if they can not give people the right description of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Aremi Soto

customer_reviews.title: and am beyond disappointed. X-large measures 5" long
customer_reviews.text: Just received the x-large moose antler, and am beyond disappointed. X-large measures 5" long, 1 1/2" wide (at widest point) and less than a 1/2" high. I have a 60lbs boxer mix that is an extremely aggressive chewer. The size of this antler, I am afraid to give it to her. I would return it but that option is unavaliable.
customer_reviews.author: Cricket64

customer_reviews.title: Overall my dog loved the antler
customer_reviews.text: Overall my dog loved the antler, but it was just too small. My 75 lb. Lab was able to go through it in only a few hours of chewing. For suppose to be an X large it was more what I would have expected out of a medium size chew.
customer_reviews.author: kitten6

customer_reviews.title: Intentionally misleading sizes
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely ridiculous how small these are. The extra large is about 4 inches long and about 1/4 inch thick. The image on my computer monitor is almost bigger than the real thing. They also are apparently not eligible for returns. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Wazzy87

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was expecting. I had purchased one that lasted 4 months but this one didn't even last a week. I will not purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: Abooza69

customer_reviews.title: "Moosarific" chews
customer_reviews.text: I get these for $5 more dollars at petco if and when I can find them. My pit bull ridgeback mix loves the moose over elk or deer, and they really help keep his teeth clean, white, and healthy
customer_reviews.author: Christoph

customer_reviews.title: I am trying to find a dog who will like it.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs had zero interest in this. I am trying to find a dog who will like it.
customer_reviews.author: SouthernNYCMelle

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: The product I received is absolutely not "x-large." It is barely the thickness of a finger and in no way resembles the product picture.
customer_reviews.author: M. Blubaugh

customer_reviews.title: Received two different items on my two orders.
customer_reviews.text: This indeed is a moose antler, but my dog chewed thru 1/4 of it in just a few hours. Last ones I bought said they where moose antlers, but turns out they where deer antlers. Much tougher to chew. So I thought I would order from them again, thinking would get the same product. Not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: XL is just the opposite
customer_reviews.text: MUCH smaller than expected for an XL order. Was not thick or cross cut and was barely 6" length. Gave it to my daughter's puppy. Not sizeable enough for 100lb dog. Will not order again.
customer_reviews.author: mom in c-town

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Expect a MUCH smaller item! A little disappointed. No way this is extra large. We can't even find it anymore because it was so small!
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Not extra large by a long shot.
customer_reviews.text: This was a huge disappointment. There is no way at all that what I received comes anywhere near an x-large.
customer_reviews.author: Julie E. Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: XL great for Sm/Med sized dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVED this antler. The size was as expected. XL size perfect for my 20lb Frenchie.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad Description waste of money
customer_reviews.text: What a rip off the description says 3x4x1 but it actually is 2 inches going down to a very sharp point.
customer_reviews.author: R P WITTIG

customer_reviews.title: Very good bone for the dog
customer_reviews.text: Very good bone for the dog. It came and it was approximately 7 inches, but hard and lasted ~ 1 month for a very active heavy chew dog.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: seems fine just having a harder time sell this one
customer_reviews.author: Buffalo B.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: my dogs aren't interested in it at all, and they always go for deer and elk antlers
customer_reviews.author: Kar Schmidt Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Moose is supposed to the hardest and longest lasting antler. This splintered and was gone in twenty minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Where's the antler?
customer_reviews.text: If this is an XL antler I'd like to know for what breed size? I have an 8 month old 85 lb Belgian Malinois and this antler is way too small! It's the size of a medium sized rib. He can't even hold it in between his paws while he's gnawing on it.
customer_reviews.author: Beaches69

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last longer than 15 minutes
customer_reviews.text: We received the antler today and our dog, Tori, loved it. However, we checked on her 15 minutes later and it was 70% gone! She chewed right through the moose antler! She isn't a powerful chewer either. The previous deer and moose antlers lasted at least a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Ziemba

customer_reviews.title: Product was very nice and meted expectations
customer_reviews.text: Product was very nice and meted expectations. However out Bernese mountain dogs tore through these in about 2 days
customer_reviews.author: Craig K.

customer_reviews.title: Way smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: Thought the price was too good to be true, turns out I was right. Actual product received is hardly what I would call 'extra large.' Misleading product advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Vogt

customer_reviews.title: Splinters
customer_reviews.text: Give to my dogs. They splinter off sharp shards. I was scared that my dogs would swallow the splinters. I tossed them right in the trash not even 1 day into giving to the dogs.
customer_reviews.author: catherine

customer_reviews.title: Way smaller than expected, and took my puppy a ...
customer_reviews.text: Way smaller than expected, and took my puppy a few hours to turn it into a nub. Definitely don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: The perfect dog chew!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. I have two pit/shepherd mixes and they are chewing machines. It can be hard to find chews that are long-lasting and enjoyable for them to gnaw on. Hard nylabones are out, but the rubbery ones are way too easy for them to eat. So I'm always on the search for something that has that perfect balance. They love the taste of these antlers and will work on them for days. They are softer than elk antlers, so I worry less about them breaking teeth. Some people have complained about the size, but they were exactly what I expected. I usually get these at Petsmart and Petco (for WAY more money!) and the sizes are the same.
customer_reviews.author: Teressa D

customer_reviews.title: You Decide For Yourself
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed. Delivered as promised but seemed small. Dog lived it though. Might try another product since won't buy again since such a small piece.
customer_reviews.author: David Bishop

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: The antler received was split and pretty small. Our dog has already made a significant dent in it (in about 2 hours of chewing) when previous antlers have lasted much, much longer (months)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lacking density
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in this product. I have purchased moose antlers previously from different companies and they have lasted months. This chew only lasted a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lentine

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: My dog had the entire antler gone in less than 20 minutes and she is not a really aggressive chewer . I have purchased many of the antlers and they usually last at least a week.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Gleason

customer_reviews.title: My main issue was that X-Large is very misleading. ...
customer_reviews.text: My main issue was that X-Large is very misleading. I had previously purchased shed pieces from other companies that were closer to the size of a 20oz bottle. This was half that size. I would consider X-Large to be a medium.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Goodhue

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: X-large? Really? Looks nothing like advertising photo! Size says 4x3x1. Not so! Heck, my phone is larger!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Galyon

customer_reviews.title: And they are unreturnable so a total waste of $$$
customer_reviews.text: these are not extra large...they are tiny. And they are unreturnable so a total waste of $$$. They are not the item they claim to be.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Hewitt

product_meta.title: Prairie Dog Pet Products Moose Antler Treat, X-Large (Assorted Color)
product_meta.description: Prairie dog antlers are north American antlers that are naturally shed or harvested. Our antlers are the highest quality north American antlers on the market today. This 100% natural dog chew is a natural source of several essential minerals that are beneficial to your dog. So go ahead and treat your furry friend to this non-allergenic, odor free, all natural dog chew! elk antlers are the softest in density and are best for puppies, older dogs, and dogs with sensitive teeth or gums. deer Antlers are moderate in density and are best for moderate chewers. (Most dogs) moose antlers are the most dense and are best for strong or active chewers (large breeds) please note that because this product is all natural, each antler will vary slightly in height, length and shape from the description shown.
feature_bullets: All-Natural Treat That Helps Satisfy Chewing Needs And Cleans Teeth
The Color May Vary Due To The Nature Of The Product

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
